titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Alfred Miller, Indictment
CWG7590

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Hopkins Cir Ct
The Comlth Ky
v
Alfred Miller

The Grand Jury of Hopkins County in the name, and by the authority of the Comlth Ky, accuse Alf Miller of the offense of an assault & Battery Committed as follows. The said Alf Miller on the 7 day of August 1865, in the County aforesaid, did Committ an assault & Battery, by beating, brusing & otherwise ill treating Nicholas Crunk, whereby the said Crunk's life was greatly endangered, and the other wrongs then & there Did, against the peace & dignity of the Comlth Ky.

Information by
Manfield Hanks
A T Thompson
S Puttman
Thos Dobyns
Nich Crunk,

Jno Barret
Comlth atty 14. Judi Distrt

Hopkins Cir Ct
Comlth Ky
v } Copy Ind
Alf Miller
